Package klykov.graph.traversal

Class WidthTraversal<T>

java.lang.Object
klykov.graph.traversal.WidthTraversal<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Traversal<T>
public class WidthTraversal<T> extends Object implements Traversal<T>
A width traversal implementation.

  • Field Details

    • help

      private boolean help
      If a user set the flag "help" on true the method will offer some values to choose when he makes a mistake or input values which are absent in the graph.

    • CONSTRAINS

      private static final int CONSTRAINS
      The amount of values = CONSTRAINTS will be offered to choose.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • DIVIDER

      private static final int DIVIDER
      If the amount of vertices less than CONSTRAINTS * 2 then it will be offered a half of vertices to choose.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • graph

      private Graph<T> graph

    • distance

      private Map<T,​Integer> distance
      The map contains vertices and the distance from the start vertex to them. Besides, the map is in charge of that one and the same vertices do not be checked and placed into the maps twice.

    • que

      private Deque<T> que
      The queue is needed for checking vertex and its adjacent vertices and etc one by one whether it equals the end vertex.

    • shortestPathTree

      private Map<T,​T> shortestPathTree
      The vertices tree where each vertex has just one parent. With the help of it we search reverse path from the end vertex to the start one.
      See Also:
      pathTo(Object, Object)

    • result

      private Deque<T> result
      When we use the method pathTo it outputs the vertices in a reverse way. This queue is needed for correct displaying the result only.

  • Constructor Details

    • WidthTraversal

      public WidthTraversal​(Graph<T> graph)

    • WidthTraversal

      public WidthTraversal​(GraphMap<T> graph, boolean help)
      Parameters:
      help - If a user set the flag "help" on true the method will offer some values to choose when he makes a mistake or input values which are absent in the graph.

  • Method Details

    • findPath

      public void findPath​(T startV, T endV)
      Finds the shortest way from startV to endV.
      Specified by:
      findPath in interface Traversal<T>

    • pathTo

      private void pathTo​(T v, T startV)
      A recursive method works according to the principal: if the current vertex is not the start value then find the parent of a current vertex with the help of shortestPathTree and repeat the algorithm.
      Parameters:
      v - It is a current vertex. Initially, it equals the end vertex.
      startV - It is the vertex which the method try to reach going from the end to the beginning of the chain.

    • randomVertex

      private T randomVertex()
      Returns a random vertex.

    • offer

      private void offer​(String massage)
      The method offers a set of random values if a user makes a mistake. Values do not repeat in the set and values have to have one an adjacent vertex at least.
      See Also:
      "DIVIDER", "CONSTRAINTS", WidthTraversal(GraphMap, boolean)
